definitions.definition: A sloping downward, e.g. of a hill or road.
A reduction or diminution of activity.
The act of declining or refusing something.
To move downwards, to fall, to drop.
definitions.example: The dollar has declined rapidly since 2001.

definitions.definition: To bend downward; to bring down; to depress; to cause to bend, or fall.
To cause to decrease or diminish.
To turn or bend aside; to deviate; to stray; to withdraw.
definitions.example: a line that declines from straightness
On reflection I think I will decline your generous offer.

definitions.definition: (grammar, usually of substantives, adjectives and pronouns) To inflect for case, number and sometimes gender.
(by extension) To run through from first to last; to repeat like a schoolboy declining a noun.
To reject a penalty against the opposing team, usually because the result of accepting it would benefit the non-penalized team less than the preceding play.
definitions.example: The team chose to decline the fifteen-yard penalty because their receiver had caught the ball for a thirty-yard gain.
